snippet: On the eve of the opening of the National People’s Congress, Xi Jinping is using the armed forces to cement his political authority and present a tough stance by China in growing territorial disputes.
abstract: Memo from China; China's Communist Party chief Xi Jinping, on the eve of the opening of the National People’s Congress, is using the armed forces to cement his political authority and present a tough stance by China in growing territorial disputes in the Pacific region; he will be appointed president at end of Congress, and is seen as moving with greater speed and assurance than predecessors like outgoing Pres Hu Jintao.

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: On the eve of the opening of the National People’s Congress, Xi Jinping is using the armed forces to cement his political authority and present a tough stance by China in growing territorial disputes.
